channel.title: Server error...need help
channel.description: guys need help plzz i am trying to make own server 1 month and it's won't work.... portforwarded and did every thing downloaded the source and the client and java jdk and everything right... and still when i log in into the server with my no-ip adress won't work and i tryed to close the anti-virus and the firewall....so what should be the problem...1 month and i am trying to make a server.... omg!can someone help me...and i called the internet control panel and checked if the port is blocked and it's not,and i called the man who i bought from him the computer..nothing changed..... so what should be the problem????someone help me plzzzz..... thax and sorry for the language i am not so good in english!

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Well no one can help you further more without you giving us all the information. That way we can double check for you. You might be doing something you think’s right, that isn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @sorlante sorlante
item.description:
@sorlante wrote:

i am sure 100% and also i run the server and i go check in runelocus server status checker…and it’s online so what can be the problem…and the no-ip duc runnin…u want my no-ip adress?

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Are you sure, you can hardly write “currectly” in your posts (no offence, I know you’re not native English). And stop being lazy and post the damn IP address so you can get a second opinion on it, along with a picture of your No-IP DUC running.

Just trying to help.

for the record: correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @sorlante sorlante
item.description:
@sorlante wrote:

i wrote it currectly 100%…
and i also compiled…
still error connecting to server…!!
please help?!?!?!u can fix it??

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Is your No-IP checked on the No-IP DUC and is it spelt correctly in the Client. It’s probably something stupid yet hard to spot, so re check then re check again.

Even post it here so someone else can see in case you’re being blind.

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @sorlante sorlante
item.description:
@sorlante wrote:

yh when i run the server it’s listening in port 0.0.0.0:43594…
so in the server side it’s port 43594…
and it’s also in the client side 43594…
someone help me plzzzzzz…!!:(:(:(:(

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Double check the ports via client side and server side are both 43594.

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @sorlante sorlante
item.description:
@sorlante wrote:

no i mean no-ip/hosting ip…
still won’t work…i put my no-ip adress in the client.java and it’s error to connecting to server…
so what’s the problem…!

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

No, you put the IP in to the client and connect to the hosted server on from that no-ip (masked IP address).

I’ve never had to put an IP in to a server in my life.

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

server sides ip as in the ip you use to run the server

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @sorlante sorlante
item.description:
@sorlante wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:8, topic:405508”][quote author=Devinhdl link=topic=502501.msg3676263#msg3676263 date=1311269674]
ok umm… server sides ip should be yor no-ip…
your personal clients ip should be 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0
when other players download your client, their client ip needs to be your no-ip
[/quote]
Server sided IP? No such thing.

So, what happens when you attempt to log in? What error/message do you get? Port 43594 may be online, but is your client and server BOTH set to 43594?[/quote]there’s no error message…
just i open up the client after running the server and i write my user and password error to connect to server…
if it’s only connect to 127.0.0.1…so it’s log in but with my ip in the client in another computer won’t work…error to connecting to server…
so someone know how to fix i plzzz help!!

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“Devinhdl, post:6, topic:405508”]ok umm… server sides ip should be yor no-ip…
your personal clients ip should be 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0
when other players download your client, their client ip needs to be your no-ip[/quote]
Server sided IP? No such thing.

So, what happens when you attempt to log in? What error/message do you get? Port 43594 may be online, but is your client and server BOTH set to 43594?

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @sorlante sorlante
item.description:
@sorlante wrote:

omg u number 10 say to me go canyouseeme!!!

Success: I can see your service on ...** on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594
see…???
it’s online!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

ok umm… server sides ip should be yor no-ip…
your personal clients ip should be 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0
when other players download your client, their client ip needs to be your no-ip

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Ok, but your computer is different. Go to http://canyouseeme.org/ and check the port is open.

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @sorlante sorlante
item.description:
@sorlante wrote:

Devinhdl i can’t understand…can u explai n more?

my source and client someone else worked in his computer so no problems on it

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Your client and server might not be compatible. Try using a packaged client and server from the same download.

Read full topic

item.title: Server error...need help
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

Lol, did you use YOUR LOCAL IP address in your client? “e.g. 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0”
your server runs on your no-ip and YOUR CLIENT ONLY uses the local ip to connect.

Read full topic
